citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
In October 2025 the facility did not provide timely and accurate information on problems of animal health behavior and
well-being through direct and frequent communication to the veterinarians. Two non-human primates were identified with
diarrhea and various treatments were initiated. The first animal was identified and treated for diarrhea on 14 Oct 25, and
then Liquid (L) stools were documented through the 18th of Oct with no verified communication with the vets. The next
veterinary assessment on 20 Oct 2025 summarized the difficulty of the case and changed the treatments, and euthanasia
was elected due to grave prognosis within 48 hours. The second non-human primate was observed to be lethargic on 23
Oct 25 and moved from group housing for closer observation - between 25-28 Oct 25 vomiting and Liquid (L) stools were
observed and the information was not verified as communicated to the vets until reassessment on 29 Oct 25. While daily
observation does not have to be done by the veterinarians, a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required
so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior and well-being is conveyed to the
attending veterinarian.
Correct by 1 February 2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the veterinary and management staff.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
In October 2025 the facility did not provide timely and accurate information on problems of animal health behavior and 
well-being through direct and frequent communication to the veterinarians. Two non-human primates were identified with 
diarrhea and various treatments were initiated. The first animal was identified and treated for diarrhea on 14 Oct 25, and 
then Liquid (L) stools were documented through the 18th of Oct with no verified communication with the vets. The next 
veterinary assessment on 20 Oct 2025 summarized the difficulty of the case and changed the treatments, and euthanasia 
was elected due to grave prognosis within 48 hours. The second non-human primate was observed to be lethargic on 23 
Oct 25 and moved from group housing for closer observation - between 25-28 Oct 25 vomiting and Liquid (L) stools were 
observed and the information was not verified as communicated to the vets until reassessment on 29 Oct 25. While daily 
observation does not have to be done by the veterinarians, a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required 
so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior and well-being is conveyed to the 
attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct by 1 February 2026. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the veterinary and management staff. 
 
 n
